colour.models.rgb.dataset.apple_rgb Module¶

Apple RGB Colourspace¶

Defines the Apple RGB colourspace:

  • APPLE_RGB_COLOURSPACE.

See also

RGB Colourspaces Jupyter Notebook

References

[1]Susstrunk, S., Buckley, R., & Swen, S. (1999). Standard RGB Color Spaces. New York, 127–134. ISBN:2166-9635
colour.models.rgb.dataset.apple_rgb.APPLE_RGB_PRIMARIES = array([[ 0.625, 0.34 ], [ 0.28 , 0.595], [ 0.155, 0.07 ]])¶

Apple RGB colourspace primaries.

APPLE_RGB_PRIMARIES : ndarray, (3, 2)

colour.models.rgb.dataset.apple_rgb.APPLE_RGB_ILLUMINANT = 'D65'¶

Apple RGB colourspace whitepoint name as illuminant.

APPLE_RGB_ILLUMINANT : unicode

Apple RGB colourspace whitepoint.

APPLE_RGB_WHITEPOINT : ndarray

colour.models.rgb.dataset.apple_rgb.APPLE_RGB_TO_XYZ_MATRIX = array([[ 0.44966162, 0.31625612, 0.18453819], [ 0.24461592, 0.67204425, 0.08333983], [ 0.02518105, 0.14118577, 0.92269093]])¶

Apple RGB colourspace to CIE XYZ tristimulus values matrix.

APPLE_RGB_TO_XYZ_MATRIX : array_like, (3, 3)

colour.models.rgb.dataset.apple_rgb.XYZ_TO_APPLE_RGB_MATRIX = array([[ 2.95197848, -1.2896043 , -0.47391531], [-1.08508357, 1.99080934, 0.03720168], [ 0.08547221, -0.26942971, 1.09102767]])¶
